intro: Piptothrix jaliscensis, commonly known as the Jalisco thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
